intro: Hieracioides heldreichiana, commonly known as the Heldreich's rock cress, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It typically grows in rocky or limestone-rich soils, often in alpine or subalpine regions. The plant features small, basal leaves that are spoon-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow, clustered in racemes, and bloom in early summer. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers.
